trans-unit.source: Represents an action restriction enforced on a set of columns in a primary key/foreign key relationship when a value or row is either deleted or updated.
A ForeignKeyConstraint restricts the action performed when a value in a column (or columns) is either deleted or updated.
Such a constraint is intended to be used with primary key columns.
In a parent/child relationship between two tables, deleting a value from the parent table can affect the child rows in one of the following ways.
- The child rows can also be deleted (a cascading action).
- The values in the child column (or columns) can be set to null values.
- The values in the child column (or columns) can be set to default values.
- An exception can be generated.

ForeignKeyConstraint objects are contained in the <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection> of a <xref:System.Data.DataTable>, which is accessed through the <xref:System.Data.DataTable.Constraints%2A> property.
Constraints are not enforced unless the <xref:System.Data.DataSet.EnforceConstraints%2A> property is set to `true`.
The <xref:System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint.AcceptRejectRule%2A> is enforced whenever a <xref:System.Data.DataTable> object's <xref:System.Data.DataTable.AcceptChanges%2A> method is invoked.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref> class with the specified parent and child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects.
The parent <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> in the constraint.
The child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> in the constraint.
One or both of the columns is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The columns have different data types.
-Or - The tables don't belong to the same <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref> class with the specified arrays of parent and child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects.
An array of parent <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> in the constraint.
An array of child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> in the constraint.
One or both of the columns is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The columns have different data types.
-Or - The tables don't belong to the same <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref> class with the specified name, parent and child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects.
The name of the constraint.
The parent <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> in the constraint.
The child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> in the constraint.
One or both of the columns is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The columns have different data types.
-Or - The tables don't belong to the same <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref> class with the specified name, and arrays of parent and child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects.
The name of the <xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref>.
If <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> or empty string, a default name will be given when added to the constraints collection.
An array of parent <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> in the constraint.
An array of child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> in the constraint.
One or both of the columns is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The columns have different data types.
-Or - The tables don't belong to the same <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.
This constructor is provided for design time support in the Visual Studio environment.

<xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref> objects created by using this constructor must then be added to the collection via <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.AddRange*>. Tables and columns with the specified names must exist at the time the method is called, or if <xref:System.Data.DataTable.BeginInit*> has been called prior to calling this constructor, the tables and columns with the specified names must exist at the time that <xref:System.Data.DataTable.EndInit*> is called.
The name of the constraint.
The name of the parent <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> that contains parent <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects in the constraint.
An array of the names of parent <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects in the constraint.
An array of the names of child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects in the constraint.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.AcceptRejectRule"></xref> values.

Possible values include <xref uid="langword_csharp_None" name="None" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_Cascade" name="Cascade" href=""></xref>, and <xref uid="langword_csharp_Default" name="Default" href=""></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.Rule"></xref> values to use when a row is deleted.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_Cascade" name="Cascade" href=""></xref>.

Possible values include: <xref uid="langword_csharp_None" name="None" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_Cascade" name="Cascade" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_SetNull" name="SetNull" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_SetDefault" name="SetDefault" href=""></xref>, and <xref uid="langword_csharp_Default" name="Default" href=""></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.Rule"></xref> values to use when a row is updated.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_Cascade" name="Cascade" href=""></xref>.

Possible values include: <xref uid="langword_csharp_None" name="None" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_Cascade" name="Cascade" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_SetNull" name="SetNull" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_SetDefault" name="SetDefault" href=""></xref>, and <xref uid="langword_csharp_Default" name="Default" href=""></xref>.
One or both of the columns is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The columns have different data types.
-Or - The tables don't belong to the same <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.
This constructor is provided for design time support in the Visual Studio environment.

<xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref> objects created by using this constructor must then be added to the collection via <xref:System.Data.ConstraintCollection.AddRange*>. Tables and columns with the specified names must exist at the time the method is called, or if <xref:System.Data.DataTable.BeginInit*> has been called prior to calling this constructor, the tables and columns with the specified names must exist at the time that <xref:System.Data.DataTable.EndInit*> is called.
The name of the constraint.
The name of the parent <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> that contains parent <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects in the constraint.
The name of the <xref:System.Data.DataTable.Namespace*>.
An array of the names of parent <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects in the constraint.
An array of the names of child <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects in the constraint.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.AcceptRejectRule"></xref> values.

Possible values include <xref uid="langword_csharp_None" name="None" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_Cascade" name="Cascade" href=""></xref>, and <xref uid="langword_csharp_Default" name="Default" href=""></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.Rule"></xref> values to use when a row is deleted.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_Cascade" name="Cascade" href=""></xref>.

Possible values include: <xref uid="langword_csharp_None" name="None" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_Cascade" name="Cascade" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_SetNull" name="SetNull" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_SetDefault" name="SetDefault" href=""></xref>, and <xref uid="langword_csharp_Default" name="Default" href=""></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.Rule"></xref> values to use when a row is updated.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_Cascade" name="Cascade" href=""></xref>.

Possible values include: <xref uid="langword_csharp_None" name="None" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_Cascade" name="Cascade" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_SetNull" name="SetNull" href=""></xref>, <xref uid="langword_csharp_SetDefault" name="SetDefault" href=""></xref>, and <xref uid="langword_csharp_Default" name="Default" href=""></xref>.
One or both of the columns is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
The columns have different data types.
-Or - The tables don't belong to the same <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref>.
Indicates the action that should take place across this constraint when <xref:System.Data.DataTable.AcceptChanges*> is invoked.
Changes to a <xref:System.Data.DataRow> or <xref:System.Data.DataTable> are not final until the `AcceptChanges` method is invoked.
At that point, the AcceptRejectRule determines the course of action on any values that have been changed or deleted.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.AcceptRejectRule"></xref> values.
Possible values include <xref uid="langword_csharp_None" name="None" href=""></xref>, and <xref uid="langword_csharp_Cascade" name="Cascade" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_None" name="None" href=""></xref>.
Gets the child columns of this constraint.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects that are the child columns of the constraint.
Gets or sets the action that occurs across this constraint when a row is deleted.
When a row is deleted from a parent table, the DeleteRule determines what will happen in the columns of the child table (or tables).
If the rule is set to `Cascade`, child rows will be deleted.
If set to `SetNull`, a `DBnull` will be placed in the appropriate columns of the affected rows.
Depending on your data source, a null value may or may not be permitted in a column.
For example, SQLServer allows multiple null values to be found in a primary key column, even if they are not unique.

In a <xref:System.Data.DataTable>, however, if a <xref:System.Data.DataColumn> object's <xref:System.Data.DataColumn.Unique%2A> property is set to `true`, multiple null values are not allowed in primary key columns.
If set to `SetDefault`, the default value for the column is assigned.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.Rule"></xref> values.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_Cascade" name="Cascade" href=""></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the current <xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref> is identical to the specified object.
The object to which this <xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref> is compared.
Two <xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref> are equal if they constrain the same columns.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>, if the objects are identical; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets the hash code of this instance of the <xref href="System.Data.ForeignKeyConstraint"></xref> object.
A 32-bit signed integer hash code.
The parent columns of this constraint.
An array of <xref href="System.Data.DataColumn"></xref> objects that are the parent columns of the constraint.
Gets the parent table of this constraint.
The parent <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> of this constraint.
Gets the child table of this constraint.
A <xref href="System.Data.DataTable"></xref> that is the child table in the constraint.
Gets or sets the action that occurs across this constraint on when a row is updated.
One of the <xref href="System.Data.Rule"></xref> values.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_Cascade" name="Cascade" href=""></xref>.
